WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Thanks for the report!

The command-line compiler does indeed bail on the first *parse* error, but not on type check errors.  This is intentional, since some parse errors may be unrecoverable, and it would be impossible to determine what the "right" JavaScript to generate would be given a malformed program.
WorkItem.Description: The compiler stops compiling when the first compile error is encountered. This means that developers not using Visual Studio end up playing "whack-a-mole" with the compiler.
WorkItem.Summary: Compiler stops when the first error is encountered
